categories.title: Recent Updates and Plugin Developments in ElizaOS

content.text: Devin has developed an Eliza plugin specifically for Devin, enhancing the chatbot's capabilities.

The Rabbi Trader plugin has received comprehensive test coverage, including tests for wallet functionality, DexScreener integration, and token utilities. The Vitest testing framework was introduced to improve reliability.
A fix was implemented for API timeout handling in the Binance plugin, improving error management and request handling.
The CoinGecko plugin was updated to use a configurable API header key instead of a hardcoded value, improving flexibility and security.
The Abstract Plugin received new actions, including token deployment, balance checking, and improved transfer functionality.
AgentKit now includes a default agent configuration, improved wallet data handling, and better environment variable management.
An OpenAI plugin was added to Eliza, enabling text generation capabilities. The integration includes improved error handling and centralized utility functions.
The BeatsFoundation plugin was updated with improved error handling, request cancellation support, and better validation for song-related actions.
A client-agnostic Devin plugin was implemented, featuring session management, API integration, and comprehensive test coverage.
The Reddit client plugin for Eliza was introduced, allowing AI agents to interact with Reddit through posting, commenting, and voting.
A bug fix was applied to correctly parse the ENABLE_OPEN_AI_COMMUNITY_PLUGIN setting, ensuring proper boolean interpretation.
The Cosmos plugin was enhanced with cross-chain swap capabilities, enabling agents to perform IBC token transfers.
A proof-of-concept Trikon plugin was introduced, featuring token transfer actions and wallet provider functionality.
A work-in-progress Roblox plugin was introduced, though details on its functionality are still being developed.
A Lightning plugin was added, enabling invoice creation and payment functionalities within the Eliza framework.

The cryptocurrency market has seen fluctuations in the prices of major assets. Wrapped Bitcoin (WBTC) experienced an increase from $101,059.37 to $101,918.62. Wrapped Ethereum (WETH) also saw a rise from $3,211.72 to $3,279.19. Solana (SOL) had a slight decline from $244.19 to $241.86. Meanwhile, ai16z showed notable growth, moving from $0.79 to $0.93.

The Eliza project has received multiple documentation updates, including the addition of a technical report to the README. This update introduces a citation section, updated project links, and an academic reference for the project.

A Japanese README file has been added, providing a comprehensive project overview, setup instructions, customization options, feature descriptions, and platform-specific requirements. It also includes guidance for local inference and testing.

The README file for the Telegram Client Plugin has been updated with a new 'Pre-Requisites' section. This section provides configuration instructions, steps for adding a bot token, and npm/pnpm command instructions for running the plugin.
The Greek README file has been updated to replace a local image path with a direct GitHub-hosted URL for the Eliza banner.

categories.title: Issues and Optimizations Related to pnpm in ElizaOS

content.text: A user encountered an issue while trying to start @elizaos/agent@0.1.9-alpha.1 using pnpm. Despite trying multiple Node.js versions, the process failed with an error related to an unsupported engine requirement (Node.js 23.3.0 was required, but the user had 22.13.0). Additionally, there were warnings about deprecated Node.js features and an eventual failure with exit code 1.

Another issue was reported regarding the installation of @elizaos/plugin-0g using pnpm. The error indicated that the dependency @elizaos/runtime was not found in the registry. The user had configured .npmrc correctly and verified token permissions but still faced a 404 error when fetching the package. They requested confirmation on whether the package and its dependencies were correctly published and if additional permissions were required.

Efforts were made to optimize pnpm cache configuration to improve package reuse during installation. Changes included moving pnpm setup before cache configuration, adding architecture-specific cache keys, including package.json in cache keys, and explicitly configuring the store directory. However, these optimizations were later reverted due to issues.

Integration tests workflow caching was improved by adding a pnpm cache step using actions/cache@v4 for node_modules and the pnpm store. Redundant pnpm cache steps were removed, and a plugin dist cache was added to prevent unnecessary rebuilds. This change aimed to reduce workflow execution time by caching dependencies and build artifacts.

@DividendUnited reacted to a post, calling it sad.
@groff questioned a purchase decision, stating they are not endorsing it.
@CurareCrypto commented on a trend, suggesting a family is becoming a new meta.
A fix was implemented in the ElizaOS project to use the header key from API config.
An issue was reported in the ElizaOS project where a bot only responds to target users and ignores other mentions on Twitter.

categories.title: Recent Updates and Issues in ElizaOS Development

content.text: ElizaOS v2 is currently being developed by Shaw to streamline the existing ElizaOS v1. Meanwhile, several new pull requests have been made to ElizaOS v1, including a @trondao plugin, and work-in-progress plugins for @zilliqa and @hiveblocks chains. Additionally, a @CryptoEternalAI transformer plugin is in development.

A new feature has been added to ElizaOS, introducing support for NVIDIA's AI models through their inference API. This integration expands ElizaOS's model provider options and includes support for three NVIDIA models: a 3B parameter model for quick responses, a 70B parameter model for balanced performance, and a 405B parameter model for complex reasoning. The implementation supports OpenAI-compatible API interfaces and allows configuration through environment variables.

A feature request has been proposed to integrate ElizaOS agents with the Virtuals Terminal API. This integration aims to improve transparency and monitoring by logging agent actions, using token-based authentication, and enabling real-time reporting. The proposal suggests a dedicated plugin to capture and report agent activities, ensuring better visibility and accountability.

A bug has been reported where ElizaOS fails to start with a custom character configuration using the GROQ API due to an incorrect OpenAI authentication error. The system incorrectly requires an OpenAI API key, preventing users from running characters without it.

categories.title: Workflow and Test Improvements in ElizaOS

content.text: The integration tests workflow in ElizaOS has been simplified by removing the cleanup step. Previously, the workflow included a `pnpm clean` command, which is no longer necessary. This change eliminates an unnecessary step, making the workflow more efficient. The update has been tested to ensure that integration tests still pass without the cleanup step.

Improvements have been made to the smoke test process in ElizaOS. These enhancements include an exact Node.js 23.3.0 version check, better server startup detection using port detection, and a status endpoint check. Additionally, unnecessary `node_modules` cleanup has been reduced, and support for `DISABLE_PLUGINS` has been added for minimal testing. Compatibility issues with `bs58` have also been addressed.

categories.title: Test Configuration and Test Suite for Client-Lens

content.text: A comprehensive test suite was implemented for the `client-lens` package to ensure robust testing without interfering with production code. The primary focus was on testing interactions with the Lens Protocol, covering authentication, profile management, and post creation.

The test suite includes a `test-utils.ts` file for test-specific implementations and comprehensive mocking of the Lens Protocol client. Three main test files were introduced:
- `client.test.ts`: Tests core client functionality.
- `interactions.test.ts`: Tests interaction handling.
- `post.test.ts`: Tests post creation and validation.
Vitest was configured for testing, including coverage reporting. The `package.json` and `tsconfig.json` files were updated to support the new test setup.
The test implementation was committed in multiple stages, including test configuration, test utilities, and individual test files for client functionality, interactions, and posts.
A new feature has been added to the Telegram client, enabling extra multimedia support.
Fixes have been implemented to resolve build and startup failures in the develop branch.
